title: Allow list the appropriate bd commands

comments.author: michaelhedgpeth
comments.text:
# Problem

I want to run bd within my claude session but don't want it to have permission that can do something destructive on the machine.

# Proposed Solution

1. Run bd --help and interact with the user on what we together think could be destructive and what should be allowed
2. For each command, decide on how to allow list it, if bd command* is needed, or bd command * is needed or what (for each command)
3. In .config/claude/settings.json, propose changes to the permissions allow
4. Explicitly add the other commands to ask section of the permission which is not there.

# Validation

Validate by asking the user if this works in a new claude session they make. This can't be automatically validated.

title: Properly set up sync branch for the project

comments.author: michaelhedgpeth
comments.text:
# Problem

I'm using a monorepo for the company with a lot of activity on it. We need to set up a sync branch so the main branch isn't polluted.

# Steps

1. Research beads documentation on how sync branches work
2. Propose a solution
3. Update the configuration for this repository to implement that solution
4. Propose documentation to the readme for how it works
